intro: Hybanthus linifolius, commonly known as the slender leaf hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Hybanthus linifolius is often found in regions with high humidity and is adapted to thrive in tropical climates.
